name: Viceroy Palm Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Viceroy for 10 nights in April 2008. It is a small but friendly Hotel. The rooms vary in size and quality but the grounds are really good. Plenty of space to sit and relax, the provision of coffee and chilled water is really nice. Staff are friendly and will always try to do the best for you. The resort fee of 24$ includes parking and lots of extras, do ask to maximise your experience. use the Spa which was also well run and offered a range of services. If you want to be in the centre of palm Springs this is a good choice.
reviews.title: Great Coffee

likes.liked: — The Staff always ready to help

reviews.text: We stayed at two hotels in Palm Springs. The Viceroy came first and impressed us with its laid-back style and friendly service. Maybe it was a little too laid-back - sometimes it felt like they were playing at running a hotel and had got a bit bored with the game - when we arrived they'd run out of tea for example - how can a hotel in the middle of town run out of TEA? The decor looks quite good but it all feels a bit cheaply done and doesn't quite hang together. The website does them no favours because it makes you expect so much more. There are great little touches though.. like gallons of free sunblock around the pool, lovely toiletries, heaps of fluffy clean towels. The staff is generally delightful and the price is quite good value for what you get. I would go again if times were tight If not I'd splash out on a villa at the (much maligned) Parker - which was a genuinely hip, totally relaxed and truly luxurious experience. Here's a tip: go in the week and the best rooms are virtually half price.
reviews.title: Nice, but not all that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Viceroy is a fabulous hotel! Everything is wonderful -- the staff, the grounds, the decor, the rooms. You name it, it is all great. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Loved every bit of it!
Never again
reviews.text: 100% style over substance. Laughably overpriced. $400-dollars a night? Are you kidding me?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where to start? Bugs, no view, extra charges, weird parking situation...barbeque poolside was embarrassingly tiny home-style. Dirty cream pitcher--Yuk.
reviews.title: Relaxed at The Viceroy

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here from 5th to 12th July 2008 and it was simply the best. We were mad enough to play golf in the very hot weather but this was arranged by them and the courses were good. They even provided freshly baked muffins for us to take as breakfast on our early morning tee times.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Danni, the cocktain wizard, was a real plus to the already excellent team at the hotel.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

likes.disliked: — Landscape needs some TLC (grass was half dead in areas)

reviews.title: Viceroy provice an amazing "Treat/Retreat" for our team
reviews.text: Food great, rooms comfortable, a bed so comfy it was hard to leave and most of all fellow guests who respected each others need to have 'quality time'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wasn't sure I wanted to spend time in Palm Springs but I am so glad we did.
reviews.title: Wonderful getaway hotel

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, great pools, and very relaxing
likes.disliked: — slow service at the restaurant/bar, unreliable internet connection, and room service is only until 9:30pm

reviews.text: I checked a few websites and found that the promotions on the Viceroy's website were the best deal.
reviews.title: The Viceroy Palm Springs- Best Hotel Ever!

likes.liked: — The grounds and the rooms were great. Lots of space and very clean and really creatively decorated
likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didnt like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great weekend (again) at this desert hotel. It was our anniversary weekend and decided to take Jack our 16 year old to the Viceroy. We had a beautiful villa next to the pool. Jack loved mooching around this beautiful bungalow and patio. Everything about the villa was perfect with huge comfortable beds, fireplace, dining room that was all very chic.
reviews.title: Great Desert Hotel for us and our dog

likes.disliked: — Wish we stayed longer than 3 days

reviews.text: The Staff are fantastic making sure our weekend was relaxing and perfect – they win! It is pretty clear that the property is cared for and the staff shows it.
reviews.title: Will NEVER Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is fantastic with awesome food and drinks delivered to the patio. This was a real treat for us out of hectic LA lives. The standard chilled mid forties with dogs people hung out without any craziness. I would recommend this hotel again and again.
reviews.title: Better than a traditional hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Viceroy this summer. The trip was part business/part vacation. The hotel is not business friendly -- AT ALL. My room wasn't ready, and I had to do a business conference call outside on my cell in the hot sun. There was no business center and no acceptable place to do the toll-free call. The only option they offered was to make the call in the hall in the hotel lobby (very noisy and no privacy).
reviews.title: Unusally, more than overcame very poor start

reviews.text: Once I finally obtained a room, the decor was shabby (they claimed I had an upgrade) and the service was poor. The conceirge wasn't helpful in making a basic restaurant recommendation, and although they claim to be "pet-friendly," they weren't very welcoming to my little pooch (one manager said they would "waive" the steep pet fee, only for me to find out upon check out that it wasn't the case). In addition, the gym needs some serious attention. Very small, no air conditioning, and shabby, dated machines.
reviews.title: Great look, great vibe for a small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I selected the Viceroy for my honeymoon after spending a day researching all of the hotels in the area (there are a LOT of nice ones here, so making the choice was especially difficult). I can honestly say that I have no regrets after staying there. It seems like traveler's opinions of this hotel vary based on what kind of experience they were looking for - family-friendly, large pool area, quiet areas, large grounds, etc. - and not on the hotel's actual quality. The Viceroy succeeds at everything it intends to be, but it is not the Hyatt or the Marriott; you will not find endless acres of landscaped grounds, a golf course, or 5 restaurants. What you get here is wonderful service, a very intimate atmosphere, a great location (nestled right between the mountains and Palm Springs' Downtown area, within walking distance), and uniquely decorated, stylish rooms. There was a family with a small child staying there at the same time as we were, but the hotel vibe is much more geared to younger travelers, single or couples. What grounds they do have are gorgeously laid out, and the pools are perfect (again, they're not big, so if a huge pool is a priority, don't stay here and then complain about the size - stay somewhere else!).
reviews.title: Intimate, beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying @ the Viceroy 2 years ago, we chose to relax there after getting married in Las Vegas knowing how hectic Vegas can be.
reviews.title: Very relaxed

likes.disliked: — Pesto on a Margarita Pizza - who would ever think??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Viceroy delieverd again. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the staff friendly and helpful. The pool scene is perfect for what we wanted. Relaxed, good service and no fuss. We were unable to bring our dog because of quarantine on the way home but I love that dogs are clearly welcomed and catered for. A nice touch.
reviews.title: What happened to the chic hotel I expected?

likes.disliked: — The lack of upkeep and the resulting appearance

reviews.text: The Wetherly Suite was good but not luxurious. We appreciated the 2 bathrooms although they were both quite small. The linens and bedding are fabulous and although the air-con was slightly loud, it did a great job at the hottest time of the year.
reviews.title: Always a HOOT!
Nice hotel, poor service
reviews.text: Room service was always quick and the food was excellent. There was an issue with one of the dishes I was served and the staff were very quick in replacing the meal without an issue.

description: Since its origins in the 1930s, Viceroy Palm Springs has redefined the ultimate Palm Springs Spa Resort experience. Luxuriously updated by Kelly Wearstler to reflect the Hollywood Regency Style popular during the desert’s original glamour era, Viceroy Palm Springs offers first-class personalized and intuitive service and amenities that guarantee a memorable experience. Experience the hotel recognized on Conde Nast’s Hot list of hotels and our Estrella Spa which was voted number 16 of the top 50 Hotel Spas in the US by Conde Nast Traveler 2011.
